storyInfo: During a case of 'empathetic expansion' that shakes Laterano, only a young executor-in-training with defective empathy is able to notice the truth.

attributes.content: Federico... Federico! You're walking too fast! Please, wait up!
attributes.name: Executor-in-Training

attributes.content: What's the matter, Trainee Roberto?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: C'mon, why are you acting so cold? Didn't we both report in to the Notarial Hall on the same day? We're practically destined to become best buds, aren't we?
attributes.name: Executor-in-Training

attributes.content: I promised Ranieri that I'd visit his sweets shop after work to have some pudding. You should come too!
attributes.name: Executor-in-Training

attributes.content: That is an agreement between you and Trainee Ranieri. There's no need to involve me.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Also, please remove your hand from my shoulder. Excessive physical contact interferes with the efficiency of my work.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: What work...? Oh, are you talking about the investigation we just did of the Pagus Stevonus Central Hospital?
attributes.name: Executor-in-Training

attributes.content: That would be the only item on our list of outstanding tasks.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: But didn't the doctor say that everyone involved in the accident came down with some disease?
attributes.name: Executor-in-Training

attributes.content: Something went wrong with the patients' collective empathy... While that's tragic, we're executors, not medics, and there's not a whole lot we can do.
attributes.name: Executor-in-Training

attributes.content: I've already reviewed the hospital records. Diseases related to the loss of collective empathy are extremely rare, with only seven recorded cases. Whereas in the past three days, we've received fifteen patients with the exact same symptoms across the various districts.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Statistical anomalies like this cannot be ignored.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: So you suspect they're not actually sick? Then, what do you think is causing all this? Ha, you don't think there's some weirdo out there purposefully stuffing their heads full of emotions that don't belong to them, do you?
attributes.name: Executor-in-Training

attributes.content: It is certainly one possibility.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: ...I was just kidding.
attributes.name: Executor-in-Training

attributes.content: I would need to do more research before making any further conjectures.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Alright then. Sounds like you won't be enjoying yourself with us. I can get a few muffins for you though – what flavor do you... Hey, would it kill you to stop walking so fast?!
attributes.name: Executor-in-Training

attributes.content: ...And that is the general outline of the case.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: As you are a famous neurosurgeon, I am here to ask for your professional opinion.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Is there any way to artificially interfere with the collective empathy between Sankta?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Interfering with our collective empathy... *cough*, *cough*! Fede, what you speak of is utterly impossible. Our empathy is a miracle unique to our race. Who could possibly hope to pry it wide open?
attributes.name: Tired Voice

attributes.content: ...Impossible?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Understood. Thank you for sharing your professional input.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: As always, I brought some food, and will leave it in the fridge.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: ...The fridge is full. I'll dump out some of the expired food before I leave.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I know how busy you are with work. You don't have to keep visiting me all the time.
attributes.name: Tired Voice

attributes.content: The curtains are drawn open.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: The curtains? *cough*, *cough* That was me. I went out a bit, earlier in the day. Why?
attributes.name: Tired Voice

attributes.content: Avuncle, I don't have classes right now, and can stay for up to a week.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I was planning on clearing up some of the clutter in the living room today. I learned some Arts for quickly crushing hard objects that should prove useful in a large cleanup.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Out of consideration for the possible noise, I'd advise you to stay inside. I'll relocate any of your valuables, so...
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: ...It's gone.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: What's gone?
attributes.name: Tired Voice

attributes.content: The cello. Arturia always kept it by the window. Now, the curtains are drawn open and the cello is gone.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Did she leave?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: ...I let her go.
attributes.name: Tired Voice

attributes.content: I sent her to Leithanien. She's had so many teachers anyway, and they've all praised her 'gift.'
attributes.name: Tired Voice

attributes.content: Hah. 'Gift'! The damn thing ruined your aunt, the woman I loved!
attributes.name: Tired Voice

attributes.content: You still can't accept her.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: How could I? Whenever I see her, whenever I hear her music... I'm reminded of the pain of losing a loved one.
attributes.name: Tired Voice

attributes.content: Mm. The pain you feel has even started to affect your physical health.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Fede, you have no idea how much I envy you. Do you not miss the people who've passed on? Like your aunt, or your parents?
attributes.name: Tired Voice

attributes.content: I remember every detail of the time I spent with them.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: But do you ever go crazy thinking about how much you miss them? Do you ever feel regret for not spending your time with them more meaningfully?
attributes.name: Tired Voice

attributes.content: Mater taught me that if I always make the best possible choice in the moment, then there is nothing to regret.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: ...Which is why I envy you. Because her music won't affect you.
attributes.name: Tired Voice

attributes.content: Ha. It goes beyond that though, child. I envy you and your lack of empathy. I envy you for not becoming addicted to emotions, let alone regret.
attributes.name: Tired Voice

attributes.content: Based on what I see, you've already started to regret your latest decision.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: You know full well that Leithanien's synthesis of musical and Arts talent will only serve to further strengthen Arturia's Arts.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: During the funeral, she made everyone who heard her music recall my aunt, and in the process revealed their hidden emotions.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Fortunately, everyone's lives returned to normal after the performance. Aside from some embarrassing memories, her music did not cause any lasting harm.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: But that may not be the case next time. When she returns to Laterano, her special 'gift' may cause even greater turmoil.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Even greater turmoil.
For example, some low-probability events that would otherwise never happen.
Federico looks to the window. Indeed, there is no longer a cello casting its shadow beside it.
But Federico's memory never errs. For the last four years, Marcello had never opened the curtains, no matter how bright the sun was outside.
To be more precise, he found it unbearable to even approach the place where the cello once rested.
When I told you about the case, I did not mention that it was an 'empathetic expansion' incident.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Hmm...
attributes.name: Tired Voice

attributes.content: You don't have to answer the questions I am about to ask, but know that I will also interpret your silence as an answer.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Avuncle Marcello, has Arturia been here recently?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Seniora, the test results have all come back. Your nerves are a bit overstimulated right now, but otherwise, there's nothing particularly wrong with your body.
attributes.name: Hospital Careworker

attributes.content: But you're still not willing to talk?
attributes.name: Hospital Careworker

attributes.content: Those two... Err, no, that one young executor came by again.
attributes.name: Hospital Careworker

attributes.content: He keeps asking to see you, but he's... a bit too blunt. The doctor is worried that his brusque manner will disrupt your mental state again, just when we've finally gotten your mood to stabilize.
attributes.name: Hospital Careworker

attributes.content: Uhh, what's this... a slip of paper? He slipped a note under the door with a name written on it.
attributes.name: Hospital Careworker

attributes.content: 'Arturia.' What's that supposed to mean?
attributes.name: Hospital Careworker

attributes.content: ...*gasp*!
attributes.name: Silent Cleric

attributes.content: Wh-Why are you so agitated all of a sudden?! Should I call the doctor?
attributes.name: Hospital Careworker

attributes.content: No... I'd like to meet with him.
attributes.name: Silent Cleric

attributes.content: Hello.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: ...I can't feel you.
attributes.name: Silent Cleric

attributes.content: If you mean that your empathy did not alert you to my presence, then that is not due to any empathetic imbalance on your part, but rather a problem with me.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Did you cut yourself off from our collective empathy, or do you suffer from some deficiency?
attributes.name: Silent Cleric

attributes.content: The professionals lean towards it being physiological.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Poor child.
attributes.name: Silent Cleric

attributes.content: You'll never know... what you are lacking.
attributes.name: Silent Cleric

attributes.content: I appreciate your concern, but I've come to the conclusion that I am perfectly capable of performing my duties.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Moving on, I'd like to ask you a direct question – have you met with Arturia Giallo recently?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: ...I have.
attributes.name: Silent Cleric

attributes.content: I saw her. No, more than that... I heard her. I heard her performing.
attributes.name: Silent Cleric

attributes.content: I can infer that she was performing at the church where you worked. Everyone who attended service that day heard her play.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I was conducting a sermon that day.
attributes.name: Silent Cleric

attributes.content: Did you know Arturia beforehand?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: ...No. That was my first time meeting her.
attributes.name: Silent Cleric

attributes.content: She sat in the corner of the front row, listened to the entire sermon, then asked me a question.
attributes.name: Silent Cleric

attributes.content: Please state the question in question.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: She asked me...
attributes.name: Silent Cleric

attributes.content: You just asked us to close our eyes and feel the emotions of our fellow countrymen sitting beside us.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: So I did.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I felt... bathed in peace and joy, just like every moment I spend in Laterano City.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: But Seniora, I can't help but wonder, what of that day five years ago?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: When those refugees, displaced by war, came to our doorsteps after crossing the wilderness, only to be ignored by you. Did you feel the pain in their hearts?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: What... are you talking about?
attributes.name: Silent Cleric

attributes.content: It seems that your memories have faded with time. Allow me to help you recall.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Among them were children and the elderly. Feline and Liberi. And also... several Sankta who'd been born elsewhere.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: They journeyed here under the guidance of a kind-hearted individual, believing that someone in Laterano would help them.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: But the hopes of those poor souls were shattered. It didn't take long for most of them to perish in the sands.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: ...And you wish to take revenge on me on their behalf, child?
attributes.name: Silent Cleric

attributes.content: Because of my fear of Oripathy, because of my inability to empathize with their suffering.... You've come here to expose me, to shame me?
attributes.name: Silent Cleric

attributes.content: No, Seniora. I have no right to retaliate against you.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: And as long as your actions match the emotions deep in your heart... I won't even judge you.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: But you are supposed to be a kind person. Please tell me – is the reason you refused to help those people because you've grown accustomed to our collective empathy, but are unable to truly feel the emotions of others?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: And I pose the same question to every person sitting here.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Arturia stands up and walks into the crowd.
She pauses and stops in front of each and every Sankta, feeling their thoughts as if they were the most intimate friends.
You blew up a flowerbed this morning. Do you feel for the others living in the same neighborhood, who are now mourning the loss of a precious childhood memory?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: And you, you were in a hurry to get home yesterday, and rushed to board the public transit. Do you feel for the elderly woman you pushed aside, who was herself anxious about not being able to get to the hospital in time?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I am the same.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: It is not that we were born selfish, weak, or dishonest.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: We simply hid beneath our Sankta halos, using our 'collective empathy' as both the premise and expression of mutual care, and deemed that to be enough.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: But can we truly accept another person's emotions as our own?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Did you answer her question?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I had no way of answering.
attributes.name: Silent Cleric

attributes.content: She posed that question to everyone present.
attributes.name: Silent Cleric

attributes.content: And afterward, she asked us, 'would you like to feel even more?'
attributes.name: Silent Cleric

attributes.content: She walked to the center of the church, lifted her bow, and began to perform... our hymn.
attributes.name: Silent Cleric

attributes.content: It's not as if she took control of us. But we were all drawn to the sound of her cello.
attributes.name: Silent Cleric

attributes.content: I had heard the same hymn countless times before, but in that moment, it was as if I was hearing its melody for the very first time.
attributes.name: Silent Cleric

attributes.content: The whole city... blossomed to life in my mind.
attributes.name: Silent Cleric

attributes.content: You're crying tears of happiness.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: That's right. Even now, I can still feel those effervescent emotions.
attributes.name: Silent Cleric

attributes.content: Some are crying, others are laughing; some are born, others pass away.
attributes.name: Silent Cleric

attributes.content: The doctors called my symptoms an 'empathy disorder.' They said that the memories I was seeing were deranged hallucinations, and wanted me to take tranquilizers.
attributes.name: Silent Cleric

attributes.content: But only I know... No, only those of us who heard that hymn know.
attributes.name: Silent Cleric

attributes.content: None of us had ever 'felt' each other before. Or 'felt' Laterano, or 'felt' the advent, continuation, and cessation of life as we did in that moment.
attributes.name: Silent Cleric

attributes.content: Under the torrent of such powerful emotions, I no longer feel shame or regret towards what I did in the past.
attributes.name: Silent Cleric

attributes.content: I know clearly that their pain will become my pain, and I will carry those memories with me as my own, until I face my next decision.
attributes.name: Silent Cleric

attributes.content: Thank you for your cooperation. I will report your testimony to the Notarial Hall.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Where are you, Federico?
attributes.name: Executor-in-Training

attributes.content: Roberto, as you are my partner, I have an obligation to inform you of my intentions.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I am ordering the arrest of Arturia, the suspect in the 'empathetic expansion' case. She is most likely in the cemetery right ahead of me.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I have already sent you the coordinates. Please be prepared to cooperate.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: G-Giallo? Isn't she your...
attributes.name: Executor-in-Training

attributes.content: Distant relative. But that has no bearing on my decision-making.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: You're here alone again, Soror.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Avuncle has also locked himself inside. The two of you haven't spoke in a long time.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Why not tell him that you're suffering?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: There's no point.
attributes.name: Calm Voice

attributes.content: Fede, my father's love for my mother blinded him to her true emotions. He wanted nothing but to keep her by his side, but she didn't want to be chained down by him.
attributes.name: Calm Voice

attributes.content: I only wanted to help him realize this, but he pushed me away.
attributes.name: Calm Voice

attributes.content: He would rather hate me than admit that it was Mamma's idea to leave him.
attributes.name: Calm Voice

attributes.content: Regardless, you shouldn't have caused such a commotion at the funeral.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: People are hurt by your music. I agree with Avuncle's judgment that you were in the wrong.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Are you also afraid of me, Fede? Just like father, and everyone else at that funeral?
attributes.name: Calm Voice

attributes.content: ...I'm not afraid of you.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: The Sankta girl stands silently before a tombstone.
She continues playing her cello, each note filled with emotions that Federico cannot feel.
All he can do is sit on the grass not far away, scrawling away and thinking, occasionally lifting his head to look at the tightly-shut windows, the vibrating strings, and the silent tombstones.
He can even discern that the sound of the cello reverberating in the wind is becoming more and more frantic.
I will stop you.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I will not allow you to continue your self-centered performance—
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: —Arturia.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: It's been a while, Fede.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Are you also here to pay a visit to Mamma?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: You know why I'm here.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: You're still exactly the same as when you were little. Always so straightforward... always so good at spoiling the mood.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Three days ago, in a church in Pagus Stevonus, you used Originium Arts on thirty-one Sanktas, causing them to suffer from an empathy disorder in serious violation of our laws.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: As an executor of the Notarial Hall, I declare you under arrest.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Did you know? Ever since you were little, I always knew you'd grow up to be an exemplary executor.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: But... Well, even I couldn't imagine that I'd be the first person you tried to arrest.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: From a certain perspective, that makes this rather amusing, doesn't it?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Federico Giallo and Arturia Giallo were born to be mortal enemies.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I do not find that amusing.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Your actions seriously threaten the stability of Laterano.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Fede, do you know why I went to that church?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: The refugees abandoned by the clerics were rescued from the battlefield by a Sankta named Luciana.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: That's right. I wanted to see where my mother went after she left Laterano, so I retraced the path she took and found the people she'd helped.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: One of these places happened to be a settlement, where my mother described the beauty of Laterano to them. She told them to come here for help in desperate times.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: She knew that most of them were Infected, and would not be accepted by the pure Holy City. But she thought that her handwritten letter would impress her former friends and colleagues.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: But what she didn't know was that most of them would treat her ideals—her feelings—as a laughingstock at her funeral.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Even the few who still held good feelings towards her... such as that cleric, would go on to look away from the plight of others.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: That does not justify harming her or any of the others present.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Harming them?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I simply allowed them to share each other's emotions.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: After that, they gained the opportunity to become brave, benevolent, and compassionate people, just as Mamma was.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: You speak of something completely uncertain and absolutely beyond your control.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: The indiscriminate expansion of the scope of Sankta empathy will affect our daily lives, causing uncontrollable panic and chaos.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: The order that people are accustomed to would cease to exist, to the point where it would become dangerous to leave one's home. Law-breaking behavior will occur on a massive scale, which may trigger a large number of Sankta falling from grace in a short period of time.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: While becoming kinder is one possibility, they may also become violent or crazed, or even turn into criminals who threaten public safety.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I see that you can't accept that the order you're so familiar with has long since lost its rationality.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Look at the truth. Emotions alone never give rise to madness. On the contrary, it is only when your heart cannot accept your own emotions that they pierce the shield of reason.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: We should have broken away from this false order constraining our emotions, making people callous, hypocritical, and cowardly.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Only afterwards can a new, emotion-driven life be truly built. We'll be more free... and have less regrets.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: It is unclear who you are referring to as 'we,' as well as the context of 'afterwards.'
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: All I know is that, much like Amita Luciana – your mother – it has no future.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Fede, you really know how to hit someone where it hurts.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I know it wasn't your intention, but... you made me feel pain so effortlessly.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Oftentimes, pain can be a wake-up call.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: However, judging from your subsequent actions, I cannot tell if you've ever experienced even a moment of remorse.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Remorse?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: If there's anything I regret, it's that I couldn't do more for my mother at the time. So she wouldn't been so easily and hastily taken by death while on the path to realizing her innermost feelings.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Your choice is irrational.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Fede, how I wish you could understand the sound of my music.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: How I wish I could share with you what I think and feel when I stand in front of my mother's tombstone, recalling those times over and over again.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I refuse. No amount of emotions justify your crimes.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I don't want to exonerate myself. I just... want you to understand me.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Put down your cello. I won't allow you to touch those strings anymore.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: My beloved brother, are you really going to point your gun at me?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Unless you decide to surrender yourself.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: You and I both know that's not possible.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Arturia, I cannot allow any enemies of Laterano to move freely about the Holy City unsanctioned.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: The sound of your music may not affect me, but the same cannot be said for others nearby.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I can no longer allow you to weave your illusions, to fill the minds of others with your unnecessary emotions, or even shake the very foundations of our collective empathy.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: You... refer to the very real memories my music brings people as the complete opposite, 'illusions.' Why? You've certainly never denied the meaning of emotions to yourself.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I really ought to hate you, Federico...
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: But still, seeing how we've been apart for so long, I've prepared a gift to celebrate our reunion.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Look over there.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: A vendor's car?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: There you are, Federico!
attributes.name: Executor-in-Training

attributes.content: I have no idea why, but a few youngsters kept trying to drag me along, saying they wanted to turn this place into a venue for a balloon contest and needed an executor there to certify it...
attributes.name: Executor-in-Training

attributes.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa... What are you doing?
attributes.name: Executor-in-Training

attributes.content: Why are you pointing your gun at another Sankta? Are you trying to fall?
attributes.name: Executor-in-Training

attributes.content: That's not a matter worth consideration in our current situation.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I can't let you do this!
attributes.name: Executor-in-Training

attributes.content: You said that you were looking for Arturia Giallo, right? She's your sister! I know there might be some history between you two, but don't be rash!
attributes.name: Executor-in-Training

attributes.content: The speeding balloon car shows no signs of stopping.
Federico springs forward, grabs the two people from the left and right sides of the vehicle as quickly as possible, and throws them onto the grass.
Countless balloons fly out of the car. The sudden kaleidoscope of colors blots out the sky as well as his vision. Though it lasted but a brief moment, it was enough.
Arturia...
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: She got away.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Executor-in-Training

attributes.content: Please take the people who were in the car just now, and report to Pagus Stevonus Central Hospital together.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: You still have things to investigate? I thought you already got to the bottom of the case!
attributes.name: Executor-in-Training

attributes.content: I'd suggest you undergo a full-body checkup.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Just now, you might all have been affected by the sound of Arturia's cello.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I don't feel any different...
attributes.name: Executor-in-Training

attributes.content: Assuming you haven't been affected, I have another suggestion.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: What is it?
attributes.name: Executor-in-Training

attributes.content: Oh! I know – you're about to suggest that I find myself a new job, right? Well shoot, I was just thinking the same thing! I knew we were destined to be best buds!
attributes.name: Executor-in-Training

attributes.content: ...And that is how my meeting with Arturia went.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Apologies, Avuncle Marcello, but I've already submitted the evidence to the Notarial Hall.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: It is said that several cardinals have personally reviewed the files and identified Arturia as a wanted individual.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: My child, you... made the correct decision. The one I couldn't bring myself to make.
attributes.name: Tired Voice

attributes.content: I keep thinking, what if I hadn't sent Arturia away... What if I hadn't closed myself off to Luciana's emotions when I learned of her death...
attributes.name: Tired Voice

attributes.content: Would she not have gone further down her misguided path?
attributes.name: Tired Voice

attributes.content: There's no point speculating.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: All I know is that it was Arturia Giallo's own choice to embark on the chaotic path she currently walks.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: And that I will personally see to it that she is brought to justice, and made to face the consequences of her actions.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: They asked you to arrest your own sister?
attributes.name: Tired Voice

attributes.content: I am the most qualified.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Not only because I am one of the few unaffected by her music... But also, even if she herself is unwilling to admit it, there's a good chance that nobody in all of Laterano knows her better than I do.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: What happens after you arrest her? Will the law... sentence her?
attributes.name: Tired Voice

attributes.content: According to the records, Laterano's laws have been supplemented and amended countless times in the millennium since the city's founding.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Considering the uniqueness of Arturia's Arts, the crimes she committed may be difficult to prosecute under our current laws—
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: But as long as she continues to pose an objective threat, the gun of an executor will continue to render correct judgments.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: You're only a kid... You just graduated.
attributes.name: Tired Voice

attributes.content: Do you think that I am incapable of taking on such a large responsibility?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Hah... If anything, I'm worried that you're a bit too responsible. Federico, I'm sure you'll become one of Laterano's best executors, just like your parents.
attributes.name: Tired Voice

attributes.content: Maybe... I really am getting old. Recently, I keep thinking back to the past.
attributes.name: Tired Voice

attributes.content: Not long after your parents passed away, when you first came to our house. Luciana was still with us, and you and Arturia were such lovely children. We'd get together to have water gun fights, and...
attributes.name: Tired Voice

attributes.content: If that is your heart's desire, I can take half a day off to play with you.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Haha. You really are a good kid.
attributes.name: Tired Voice

attributes.content: Actually, there is one thing... that you yourself might not have made sense of.
attributes.name: Tired Voice

attributes.content: You say that Arturia hates you because you deny the meaning of emotion.
attributes.name: Tired Voice

attributes.content: But it might just be that she knows you better than you know yourself.
attributes.name: Tired Voice

attributes.content: Please elaborate.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Federico, you're the most sincere and open child I've ever met. You never run from your past, and you never suppress any of your emotions.
attributes.name: Tired Voice

attributes.content: You've left Arturia at a complete loss... along with her Arts.
attributes.name: Tired Voice

attributes.content: I find myself somewhat puzzled at your statement.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Then every once in a while, just stop thinking.
attributes.name: Tired Voice

attributes.content: So, come on in and let your uncle give you a hug, okay?
attributes.name: Tired Voice

attributes.content: This request for physical contact makes me...
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: The door that had been closed for eight years was open.
The curtains were never closed again, revealing window panes as clean and clear as the blue sky.
On the table are several muffins and a glass of steaming water.
...A hug is an acceptable request.
attributes.name: Federico
